title: Bit Meda
content: This is it so far. Please let me know what you think.
author: carbonframe

comments.content: Hello Andrew. looks like you are having problem in upload. Make image jpg and rgb (CMYK does not work). I have made this mistake in my upload so I recommend checking this first.
The oblique version is very distinguishable from the roman, but not too different... it definitely seems like part of the same family. Good job.

Thank you John. I was really going for a cursive feeling with the oblique. It's something I haven't seen in many screen fonts and I find it quite appealing.   
   
Again, I aplogize about the double post. It was around midnight last night (for me) and I had been staring at my screen all day. Just took me a couple tries to get it right.
nice! love the italics. the smallcaps seem a bit uneven in width, "A" bothers me a bit... seems a bit too wide or "open", and EFG look narrower than the rest...

I think this font has some really great features - including the brave attempt at a cursive italic: like that dot on the "i" is genial. But some things make me happy I'm not in your shoes on this one! :-) Also, I'd make the smallcaps one pixel taller.   
   
BTW, your text setting I find pretty encouraging.   
   
hhp
